parameters.name: EnsRegionIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the regions. The value is a JSON array that consists of up to 100 IDs. Separate multiple IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: EnsServiceId
parameters.description: The ID of the edge service. You can use the ID to query information about the instances that are created in the edge service.

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the instances. The value is a JSON array that consists of up to 100 IDs. Separate IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: InstanceResourceType
parameters.description:
The condition that you want to use to filter instances by category. Valid values:

*   EnsInstance: ENS instances that you purchase.
*   EnsService: ENS instances that belong to edge services.
*   BuildMachine: ENS instances that are configured with image builders.
*   EnsPostPaidInstance: Pay-as-you-go ENS instances that you purchase.

parameters.name: IntranetIp
parameters.description: The internal IP address of the instance.

parameters.name: OrderByParams
parameters.description:
The method that you want to use to sort instances. The value of this parameter is in the JSON format.

You can sort instances by name, expiration time, node ID, or creation time. You can specify one or more methods.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description:
The number of the page to return. Pages start from page **1**.

Default value: **1**.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
The number of entries to return on each page. The maximum value is **100**.

Default value: **10**.

parameters.name: SearchKey
parameters.description: The keyword that you use to query the logs of the service. You can specify the values of parameters such as **ip**, **InstanceName**, and **InstanceId** as the keyword.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the security group.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the instance. Valid values:

*   Running
*   Stopped
*   Expired
